info.description: This is the Ridash API server for user authentication and management
info.title: Ridash API

post.description: Authenticates a user with email and password, sets refresh/access token cookies

parameters.description: Login request with email and password
parameters.name: request

200.description: Login successful, refresh token set in cookie

400.description: Invalid request body or invalid credentials

500.description: Internal server error (transaction, database, or password verification failure)

get.description: Redirects user to OAuth provider for authentication

parameters.description: Redirect URL after successful OAuth linking
parameters.name: next

get.description: Handles OAuth provider callback, processes authorization code, creates/links user accounts, and issues authentication tokens

parameters.description: OAuth state parameter for CSRF protection
parameters.name: state

307.description: Redirect to success URL with authentication cookies set

400.description: Invalid provider, oauth state, or verification failed

500.description: Internal server error during user creation or token generation

post.description: Refreshes the access token using the refresh token cookie and issues new access/refresh token cookies

201.description: Access token generated successfully, new refresh token set in cookie

401.description: Refresh token not found, invalid, or already used

500.description: Internal server error (transaction, database, or token generation failure)

post.description: Creates a new user account with email and password

400.description: Invalid request body or email already in use

get.description: Returns 200 when the user is authenticated via access token cookie
Lists teams the authenticated user is a member of

post.description: Creates a new team and assigns the requesting user as owner

get.description: Retrieves a single team the authenticated user belongs to

put.description: Updates a team name (owner or admin only)

400.description: Invalid request body or team ID

get.description: Lists incidents for a team the user has access to

post.description: Manually creates an incident for a monitor the user has access to

get.description: Retrieves a single incident for a monitor the user has access to
Lists events for an incident the user has access to

post.description: Adds a new event to an incident timeline
Updates an incident's status and records a timeline event

get.description: Lists monitors for a team the user belongs to

post.description: Creates a monitor for the given team (owner/admin only)

400.description: Invalid request body or team ID

get.description: Retrieves a monitor for a team the user belongs to

400.description: Invalid team ID or monitor ID

put.description: Updates a monitor for a team (owner/admin only)

delete.description: Deletes a monitor for a team (owner/admin only)

400.description: Invalid team ID or monitor ID

get.description: Returns uptime and latency analytics for a monitor within a window (default last 24h, bucket 30m)
Lists notifications for a team the user belongs to

post.description: Creates a notification channel for the given team (owner/admin only)

400.description: Invalid request body or team ID

get.description: Retrieves a notification for a team the user belongs to

400.description: Invalid team ID or notification ID

delete.description: Deletes a notification for a team (owner/admin only)

400.description: Invalid team ID or notification ID

patch.description: Updates a notification for a team (owner/admin only)

post.description: Sends a test message to verify a notification configuration (owner/admin only)

400.description: Invalid team ID or notification ID

post.description: Creates a status page with groups and monitors for the given team (owner/admin only)

put.description: Updates slug/icon/groups/monitors for the given status page (owner/admin only)

BearerAuth.description: Type "Bearer" followed by a space and JWT token.
BearerAuth.name: Authorization
